title: Helping Left-Behind Communities Make a Comeback

enrichment.summary: This executive order directs federal agencies to coordinate and improve support for economically distressed and left-behind communities by enhancing access to existing programs, promoting community engagement, and encouraging place-based economic development. It aims to strengthen disaster resilience and facilitate equitable access to federal funding opportunities for local, Tribal, and rural areas facing economic challenges.
potential_concerns: Coordination among multiple federal agencies may be challenging, leading to inefficiencies or overlapping efforts.
Some economically distressed communities could be overlooked if not clearly defined or identified by federal criteria.
Preference for covered communities in funding might reduce resources available to other similarly needy but non-designated areas.
Implementation depends on availability of appropriations, which could limit effectiveness or create uncertainty.
The broad definitions of covered communities and criteria might create confusion or inconsistent application across agencies.
